manual.title: Manual
manual.name: Name
manual.ch1_intro: Welcome to Stagebox! This guide walks you through the first steps to set up your first building.
manual.ch1_admin_intro: To create a new building, you first need to log in as administrator.
manual.ch1_admin_step1: Click on Admin in the left sidebar.
manual.ch1_admin_step2: The factory Admin PIN is '0000'. Please change it immediately and store it in a safe place.
manual.ch1_admin_step3: On subsequent visits, enter your PIN to unlock the admin area.
manual.ch1_building_intro: After admin login, you can create a new building:
manual.ch1_building_step1: Click on New Building in the admin area.
manual.ch1_building_step2: Enter a name (only lowercase letters, numbers and underscores).
manual.ch1_settings_intro: Before you can provision devices, you need to configure the network settings:
manual.ch1_wifi_intro: The Shelly devices will connect to this WiFi network:
manual.ch1_wifi_ssid: Name of the primary WiFi network
manual.ch1_wifi_fallback: Optional: Backup network if primary is unreachable
manual.ch1_ip_intro: The IP pool defines the static IP addresses for your devices:
manual.ch1_ip_start: First IP address in the pool (e.g. 192.168.1.100)
manual.ch1_ip_end: Last IP address in the pool (e.g. 192.168.1.200)
manual.ch1_ip_dhcp: Range to scan for new devices
manual.ch1_ip_warning: The IP pool must not overlap with your router's DHCP range! Reserve a separate range for Stagebox.
manual.ch2_intro: The provisioning workflow consists of 4 stages that take a new Shelly device from factory state to fully configured.
manual.ch2_s1_desc: WiFi configuration via Shelly Access Point
manual.ch2_s2_desc: Assign static IP from the pool
manual.ch2_s3_desc: Firmware update and set Friendly Name
manual.ch2_s1_intro: In Stage 1, Stagebox connects to the Access Point of a new Shelly device and configures it for your network.
manual.ch2_s1_step1: Connect the new Shelly device to power. It creates its own Access Point (e.g. ShellyPlus1-XXXX).
manual.ch2_s1_step2: Click on S1 AP Setup in Stagebox.
manual.ch2_s1_step3: In loop mode: Stagebox automatically waits for new devices. Ideal for multiple devices in sequence.
manual.ch2_s1_step4: The device is configured: WiFi, Cloud disabled, Bluetooth disabled, AP disabled.
manual.ch2_s1_result: The device is now in your WiFi network with a DHCP address. It does not yet appear in the device list.
manual.ch2_s2_intro: Stage 2 scans the DHCP range for new Shelly devices and assigns them a static IP from the pool.
manual.ch2_s2_step2: Stagebox scans the configured DHCP range.
manual.ch2_s2_step3: Found devices receive a static IP and a technical hostname.
manual.ch2_s2_step4: The devices now appear in the device list.
manual.ch2_s3_intro: Stage 3 updates the firmware and sets the device's Friendly Name.
manual.ch2_s3_step1: Select devices in the list (or all with stage filter).
manual.ch2_s3_step3: Stagebox checks the firmware version and performs an update if needed.
manual.ch2_s3_step4: The Friendly Name is composed from Room + Location.
manual.ch2_s3_tip: Set Room and Location in the Details tab before running Stage 3. This way your devices get meaningful names like "Living Room Ceiling Light".
manual.ch2_s4_intro: Stage 4 applies the final configuration: device profiles and scripts.
manual.ch2_s4_step3: The device profile is loaded and settings applied (input types, switch modes, etc.).
manual.ch2_s4_step4: Assigned scripts are deployed and started.
manual.ch3_intro: After provisioning, you can manage, configure and monitor your devices through the Web UI.
manual.ch3_list_intro: The device list shows all provisioned Shelly devices:
manual.ch3_list_status: Green dot = Online, Red dot = Offline
manual.ch3_list_search: Search by name, IP, MAC, Room or Location
manual.ch3_list_filter: Filter by Stage or Online/Offline status
manual.ch3_details_intro: In the Details tab you can view and edit device information:
manual.ch3_details_location: Position in the room (e.g. Ceiling, Left Wall)
manual.ch3_switch_initial: Initial State: Behavior after power outage
manual.ch3_switch_input: Input type: Button, Switch, or detached
manual.ch3_scripts_step1: Select a script from the list (Local or GitHub Library).
manual.ch3_scripts_step2: Select target devices (only online devices available).
manual.ch3_scripts_step4: The script is uploaded in chunks and started.
manual.ch3_kvs_intro: The Key-Value Store saves persistent data on the device:
manual.ch3_kvs_info: KVS entries are typically created by scripts. Here you can view and adjust existing values.
manual.ch4_intro: Administrative functions for backup, export and system management.
manual.ch4_labels_intro: Export device labels as CSV for label printers (Brother, DYMO):
manual.ch4_labels_step1: Click on Export Labels (CSV) in the sidebar.
manual.ch4_labels_content: The CSV contains: Name, Room, Location, IP, MAC - ideal for labeling stickers.
manual.ch4_snapshots_intro: Snapshots save the current configuration state of all devices:
manual.ch4_snapshots_audit: Run Audit - Compare current configuration with snapshot
manual.ch4_snapshots_tip: Create a snapshot after completing the installation. This way you can detect changes later.
manual.ch4_backup_usb_step3: All building data is copied to the stick.
manual.ch4_backup_nas_intro: In the admin area you can configure a NAS for automatic backups:
manual.ch4_backup_nas_step4: Use Backup to NAS to start a manual backup.
manual.ch4_system_intro: System functions in the Greeting Screen:
manual.ch4_system_shutdown: Shut down Stagebox (safe before disconnecting power)
manual.ch4_system_warning: Always shut down Stagebox via Shutdown before disconnecting power to avoid data loss.
